DataElement.preferredName: Product Combined Additive Infusion Procedure Total Volume Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the total volume of the product (e.g.,human drugs; therapeutic biologics; allergenics; cells, tissue and gene therapy products; blood components and blood derivative products) with combined additives for the infusion procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A thing produced by or resulting from a process. EXAMPLE(S): drug, device. The FDA list of regulated products: animal and human drugs; therapeutic biologics; allergenics; cell, tissue and gene therapy products; blood components; blood derivative products; devices; and animal (pets and livestock) and human food/feed (medicated and un-medicated); cosmetics; pet treats; and dietary supplements._Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more._A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics._Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.

Concepts.definition: The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.

Property.preferredDefinition: Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more.:A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.

Concepts.definition: Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more.
A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
